channel.title: Map of the server!
channel.description:
[quote="Moparisthebest"]The map is neat! Turns out my castle is about twice as far as varrock from the spawn, I'll have to try to map out a path from my castle directly to varrock later, I was just going to /spawn first.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/worldmap/
I'll probably update it around 5am EST every morning I think.[/quote]

item.title: Map of the server!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“zuppers, post:63, topic:377584”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=473481.msg3632934#msg3632934 date=1308371285]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=473481.msg3632816#msg3632816 date=1308363632]
Yea, something is seriously wrong with it and I haven’t got a chance to look and try to find the problem. All I know is it takes something like 5 hours to run to completion (it used to take like 10 minutes max, even on the previous map which was much bigger), and it frequently uses 100% of the CPU, stopping even the forum from working and kicking people off the server. Sorry about that.
[/quote]Could it possibly have something to do with the fact people are at coords like 20000, 20000 because of the new nether updates (moving 8X as far)
[/quote]This is what I’m thinking there’s probably some sort of memory leak in the generation algorithm for land which isn’t connected via walking.[/quote]Yea that’s what I thought too, it’s probably some sort of loop and it’s reading ALL that empty space.

Read full topic

@xryz wrote:

Ok. Anyone better than me at web programming, want to do this? I could probably attempt it. Probably wouldn’t be too hard and good experience but idk how long it would take to code.

edit: i am going to try to work on this in my free time. right now i have to get a project due thats due in < 12 hours. i found out that the point the map begins on is at 0,0 on the map.

Read full topic

Why don’t you (or someone else) download the worldmap files, add the controls, and give them back to me. Then I can incorporate it into the automatically updating script.

Read full topic

item.title: Map of the server!
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I don’t know if that is possible or not, it uses the google maps api and I generate it with the script that comes with c10t, if anyone cares to google for the answer or try to do it themselves, I’d be more than happy to implement it here too.

i was inspecting the code with chromes dev tools. making something that will get u to the coords is a matter of knowing the size of the rendered map, and know the api for google maps. i would have to look at the api, but u need to know how to resize to a specific point. i know there is some method in the api for this(if u go on maps.google.com and go to a location then send a link to that location when u click that like google maps automatically zooms into those coords. there is some api to design additonal gui content i guess, b/c that day and night dropdown box i dont believe comes with google maps.

a sample of what the method call should look similar to:
point(canvas.width-(canvas.width-xCoordTBox), canvas.height-(canvas.height-yCoordTBox))
point(canvas.width/2+xCoordTBox), canvas.height/2+yCoordTBox) // i think that would be more accurate, than the sample i have above.

by ycoord i mean the z coord in mc. im not exactly sure where the 0,0 coord is on the map but im guessing its the center of the map so thats why i did the canvas.width/2 and height/2, to get the px value of 0,0. then the inputed values are added to that found value. by canvas im meaning all the area the map is contained in.

its just an idea i have in my head atm. i dont have the time right now to experiement with this but it sound reasonable, right?

now time to eat some food for lunch.

edit: fixed the method call b/c after thinking about it i was like wait that is totally wrong.

here is the link to the google maps api: http://code.google.com/apis/maps/documentation/javascript/reference.html

nvm about the thing i said about the drop down menu. that is in the api, u add option in the option.js. mitb u can add a some stuff to that, like u can add markers within the [] of markers. i cant make out exactly what all those values are for but i can make guesses. im guessing “st” is for the start point.

for the form part u can just make a simple form with 2 textboxs where u enter the x,z values, and a button that calls the methods that take u to that location.

this may help with adding the form: http://code.google.com/apis/maps/documentation/javascript/controls.html#CustomControls

Read full topic
